intro: Leochilus leochilinus, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in countries like Afghanistan and Pakistan. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
